OHBM 2010


Listed below are talks from the OHBM 2010 "Introduction to Imaging Genetics" workshop.

Organized by:
Thomas Nichols, University of Warwick and Jean-Baptiste Poline, Neurospin

Description

This course will introduce the fundamentals of "Imaging Genetics," the process of modeling and understanding genetic variation in brain image data. The course begins with a four-lecture genetics tutorial in the morning, designed to give imaging practitioners a quick overview of key genetics concepts and terminology. The remainder of the course covers how imagers can use genetic variables in their analyses. Specific topics include voxel-wise genome-wide models, joint multivariate modeling of imaging and genetic data, and heritability analyses of cortical surface and thickness data. The course concludes with two case studies highlighting current imaging genetics research.

Talks

  • 8:15 - 9:00:
    Molecular Basis of Genetic Variation
    Author: Trygve Bakken. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5593372.v1
  • 9:00 - 9:45:
    Structure and Analysis of Genetic Variation
    Author: Fabio Macciardi. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5593375.v1
  • 10:00 - 10:45:
    Quantitative Traits: Heritability, Linkage & Association
    Author: David Glahn. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5593378.v1
  • 10:45 - 11:30:
    Epistasis: Machine Learning Approaches
    Author: Kristin Nicodemus. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5593381.v1
  • 11:30 - 12:00:
    What Brain Imaging Has to Offer Genetics, and Vice Versa
    Author: Andreas Meyer-Lindenberg.
  • 13:00 - 13:30:
    Overview of Neuroimaging Phenotypes
    Author: Roberto Toro. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5593384.v1
  • 13:30 - 14:05:
    Univariate Approaches: Multiple Testing & Voxelwise WGA
    Author: Jason Stein. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5593387.v1
  • 14:05 - 14:40:
    Multivariate Approaches: Joint Modeling of Imaging & Genetic Data
    Author: Giovanni Montana. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5593396.v1
  • 14:44 - 15:30:
    Heritability: Unique Genetic Contributions to Cortical Volume & Thickness
    Author: Anderson Winkler. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5593390.v1
  • 15:30 - 16:00:
    Imaging genetics: Adventures in the dopaminergic system
    Author: Christian Buchel. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5485030.v1
  • 16:00 - 16:30:
    Case Study: Genetic Control of Aversive Processing in the Amygdala
    Author: Anne Beck. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5593393.v1

Oxford Big Data Institute at the University of Oxford
